intro: Bartlettina pansamalensis, commonly known as the Panamá star vine, is a climbing plant native to the humid lowland forests of Panama. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, often emitting a faint fragrance. Bartlettina pansamalensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
